tags: did yeza go to the acadamy
is he cool with the empire/cerebus/etc
does he fully understand his project from them
whats his opinion on the empire in general
is he ok with the kind of stuff they do to people
does nott know anything about this
summary: "While I find this alchemist obnoxious in his simplicity, the Academy’s eye for talent proves itself again, for at the very...
body:
“While I find this alchemist obnoxious in his simplicity, the Academy’s eye for talent proves itself again, for at the very least his instincts are solid, and his intellect too limited for disloyalty.”

Anyway I’ve got to wonder:

  1. How long has Yeza has been working with the Empire/Cerberus Assembly/etc.?
  2. Did he actually go to the academy at some point, or was he somehow simply picked by them for this purpose?
  3. How much did he know about this project and the intentions of the people directing it? Does “loyalty” indicate that he has some understanding of the full scope of this assignment and that he’s on board with it?
  4. Did Nott know anything about this/how much does she really know about Yeza?

Especially because depending on the way her backstory spins out, and what the answers to these questions are, Nott’s life has probably been, directly or indirectly, more affected and intertwined with the intentions and experiments of the Empire and the Cerberus Assembly than just what we’ve seen in this episode.

reblog.comment:
“While I find this alchemist obnoxious in his simplicity, the Academy’s eye for talent proves itself again, for at the very least his instincts are solid, and his intellect too limited for disloyalty.”

Anyway I’ve got to wonder:

  1. How long has Yeza has been working with the Empire/Cerberus Assembly/etc.?
  2. Did he actually go to the academy at some point, or was he somehow simply picked by them for this purpose?
  3. How much did he know about this project and the intentions of the people directing it? Does “loyalty” indicate that he has some understanding of the full scope of this assignment and that he’s on board with it?
  4. Did Nott know anything about this/how much does she really know about Yeza?

Especially because depending on the way her backstory spins out, and what the answers to these questions are, Nott’s life has probably been, directly or indirectly, more affected and intertwined with the intentions and experiments of the Empire and the Cerberus Assembly than just what we’ve seen in this episode.

trail.content_raw:
“While I find this alchemist obnoxious in his simplicity, the Academy’s eye for talent proves itself again, for at the very least his instincts are solid, and his intellect too limited for disloyalty.”

Anyway I’ve got to wonder:

  1. How long has Yeza has been working with the Empire/Cerberus Assembly/etc.?
  2. Did he actually go to the academy at some point, or was he somehow simply picked by them for this purpose?
  3. How much did he know about this project and the intentions of the people directing it? Does “loyalty” indicate that he has some understanding of the full scope of this assignment and that he’s on board with it?
  4. Did Nott know anything about this/how much does she really know about Yeza?

Especially because depending on the way her backstory spins out, and what the answers to these questions are, Nott’s life has probably been, directly or indirectly, more affected and intertwined with the intentions and experiments of the Empire and the Cerberus Assembly than just what we’ve seen in this episode.
trail.content:
“While I find this alchemist obnoxious in his simplicity, the Academy’s eye for talent proves itself again, for at the very least his instincts are solid, and his intellect too limited for disloyalty.”

Anyway I’ve got to wonder:

  1. How long has Yeza has been working with the Empire/Cerberus Assembly/etc.?
  2. Did he actually go to the academy at some point, or was he somehow simply picked by them for this purpose?
  3. How much did he know about this project and the intentions of the people directing it? Does “loyalty” indicate that he has some understanding of the full scope of this assignment and that he’s on board with it?
  4. Did Nott know anything about this/how much does she really know about Yeza?

Especially because depending on the way her backstory spins out, and what the answers to these questions are, Nott’s life has probably been, directly or indirectly, more affected and intertwined with the intentions and experiments of the Empire and the Cerberus Assembly than just what we’ve seen in this episode.

tags: i'm calling this ship zuasha now
summary: Day 4 of @critrolefemslash week! “Alternative universe” + “canon ship” modern AU ft. the wives. Yasha is very goth. Zuala is her...
caption:
Day 4 of @critrolefemslash week! “Alternative universe” + “canon ship” modern AU ft. the wives. Yasha is very goth. Zuala is her pastel gf. Yasha has pre-fallen grey hair that she dyes for the aesthetic. Zuala lets her strong wife carry all the groceries, all the time. Yasha doesn’t mind at all.
And yeah, that’s a flower tattoo peeking through. You’re welcome.

summary: Between the Beth reveal, just-Fjord who disguises everything up to and including his dang voice, and Caleb “I’m desperately on...
body: Between the Beth reveal, just-Fjord who disguises everything up to and including his dang voice, and Caleb “I’m desperately on the run but always introduce myself by my full name” Widogast, I look forward to someday learning the actual names of half the party.

reblog.comment: Between the Beth reveal, just-Fjord who disguises everything up to and including his dang voice, and Caleb “I’m desperately on the run but always introduce myself by my full name” Widogast, I look forward to someday learning the actual names of half the party.

trail.content_raw: Between the Beth reveal, just-Fjord who disguises everything up to and including his dang voice, and Caleb “I’m desperately on the run but always introduce myself by my full name” Widogast, I look forward to someday learning the actual names of half the party.
trail.content: Between the Beth reveal, just-Fjord who disguises everything up to and including his dang voice, and Caleb “I’m desperately on the run but always introduce myself by my full name” Widogast, I look forward to someday learning the actual names of half the party.

tags: this is super rambling and probably makes no sense but like...
i am 99% sure molly's whole existence is the result of a fucked up reincarnation lucien was trying
now i havent listened to cree's spiel about the ritual from ep 14 in a while so i might be totally wrong
especially re: nonagon = nine and dunamancy is the 9th school of magic
i feel like i should have one of those wall maps with push pins and string connecting everything
molly not having a soul also lines up with taliesin's concerns that molly couldn't be resurrected even if they did have access to the magic
summary: given all of the dunamancy (sp?) stuff that we now know the rexxentrum mages are messing with/studying i think those old “Molly...
body: given all of the dunamancy (sp?) stuff that we now know the rexxentrum mages are messing with/studying i think those old “Molly was the soulless version of Lucien’s body and that why he was saying “empty” when he first woke up” theories are even more likely now that we know reincarnation was a huge part of what they were studying with the beacons, so the “lady mage from rexxentrum” helping lucien and cree could have been using lucien as a test subject for the beacon’s reanimation properties and either it failed and destroyed lucien’s soul leaving an empty body OR it did succeed and lucien is out there somewhere in a new body, (possibly as a child and thats why cree can’t find him) but they didn’t anticipate what to do with his body afterwords and just assumed it died without his soul but it didn’t and that how Molly came into being

reblog.comment: given all of the dunamancy (sp?) stuff that we now know the rexxentrum mages are messing with/studying i think those old “Molly was the soulless version of Lucien’s body and that why he was saying “empty” when he first woke up” theories are even more likely now that we know reincarnation was a huge part of what they were studying with the beacons, so the “lady mage from rexxentrum” helping lucien and cree could have been using lucien as a test subject for the beacon’s reanimation properties and either it failed and destroyed lucien’s soul leaving an empty body OR it did succeed and lucien is out there somewhere in a new body, (possibly as a child and thats why cree can’t find him) but they didn’t anticipate what to do with his body afterwords and just assumed it died without his soul but it didn’t and that how Molly came into being

trail.content_raw: given all of the dunamancy (sp?) stuff that we now know the rexxentrum mages are messing with/studying i think those old “Molly was the soulless version of Lucien’s body and that why he was saying “empty” when he first woke up” theories are even more likely now that we know reincarnation was a huge part of what they were studying with the beacons, so the “lady mage from rexxentrum” helping lucien and cree could have been using lucien as a test subject for the beacon’s reanimation properties and either it failed and destroyed lucien’s soul leaving an empty body OR it did succeed and lucien is out there somewhere in a new body, (possibly as a child and thats why cree can’t find him) but they didn’t anticipate what to do with his body afterwords and just assumed it died without his soul but it didn’t and that how Molly came into being
trail.content: given all of the dunamancy (sp?) stuff that we now know the rexxentrum mages are messing with/studying i think those old “Molly was the soulless version of Lucien’s body and that why he was saying “empty” when he first woke up” theories are even more likely now that we know reincarnation was a huge part of what they were studying with the beacons, so the “lady mage from rexxentrum” helping lucien and cree could have been using lucien as a test subject for the beacon’s reanimation properties and either it failed and destroyed lucien’s soul leaving an empty body OR it did succeed and lucien is out there somewhere in a new body, (possibly as a child and thats why cree can’t find him) but they didn’t anticipate what to do with his body afterwords and just assumed it died without his soul but it didn’t and that how Molly came into being
